sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"选择"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: choose, select, elect, pick, prefer, opt
means: choose ： 普通用词，侧重根据个人意愿和判断从众多的对象中进行选择，着重被选者的优点。
select ： 书面用词，具有庄严、正式的感情色彩。强调精选。
elect ： 指按照一定的规章或法律，用投票等方式进行的认真慎重的选择。
pick ： 口语用词，多指从个人角度仔细挑选，也含任意挑选之意。
prefer ： 强调个人偏爱，不一定有选择的行动。
opt ： 多指在几种可能性之间进行选择。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"喜欢，喜爱"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: like, love, enjoy, fancy, adore, prefer
means: like ： 最常用词，往往只表不太强烈的兴趣或关注，不带强烈的感情，除非另加修饰语。
love ： 不但表示强烈的喜欢，而且含依恋之情，因此多用于能激起深厚情感的人或物。
enjoy ： 指对能提供感观或智力上满足或快乐的东西表示欣赏或喜爱。
fancy ： 指喜爱投合自己心意、嗜好或欲望等的人或物。
adore ： 非正式用词，口语体。指非常喜爱，带强烈的感情色彩。
prefer ： 指有选择性或偏向性的喜欢。

sentence.Network_en: I would prefer him to be with us next season.
sentence.Network_cn: 我更希望他下一个赛季和我们在一起。

sentence.Network_en: I think more customers probably prefer a soft sell.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为更多的顾客也许更喜欢软性推销。

sentence.Network_en: They prefer to bargain with individual clients, for cash.
sentence.Network_cn: 在现款方面，他们更愿意同散户打交道。

偏好 (PREFERENCE)及其表述偏好是指消费者按照他们的愿望对消费束的排列。 消费束是消费者选择的目标，是一个完整的商品和  …
英语四级词组免费下载 - 豆丁网 ... potential a. 潜在的 - 【考】 preferable a. 更好的 - 73 prevail vt. 压倒、胜过 - 【派】.
英语单词立体记忆 ... → prefer 偏向于 → preferable 更可取的，更好的 → preference 偏爱，优先.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French preferer, from Latin praeferre, from prae 'before' + ferre 'to bear, carry'

entry.def: If you prefer someone or something, you like that person or thing better than another, and so you are more likely to choose them if there is a choice.

example.ex: Does he prefer a particular sort of music?...
example.tran: 他有特别喜欢的音乐吗？

example.ex: I became a teacher because I preferred books and people to politics...
example.tran: 我当了老师，因为我更喜欢书本和人而不是权术。

sentences.sentence: "Some people prefer camping to staying in hotels"

means.word_mean: 2. select as an alternative; choose instead; prefer as an alternative;

sentences.sentence: "I always choose the fish over the meat courses in this restaurant"
"She opted for the job on the East coast"

means.word_mean: 4. give preference to one creditor over another

auth_sentence.content: I'll still prefer new world wines anyway though.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'll still prefer new world wines anyway though.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'll still prefer new world wines anyway though.

auth_sentence.content: In these times I would prefer philosophies that work.
auth_sentence.res_content: In these times I would prefer philosophies that work.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In these times I would prefer philosophies that work.

auth_sentence.content: I would prefer to say right up front quakery.
auth_sentence.res_content: I would prefer to say right up front quakery.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I would prefer to say right up front quakery.

pre在……前的,预先+school学校→上学前的
pre在……前的,预先+sci知道+ent表形容词→预先知道
pre在……前的,预先+amble跑→跑在前面→前言
pre在……前的,预先+caution小心→预先小心→预防
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+ent人或物等→走在前面的东西→先例
pre在……前的,预先+cept拿→以前拿好的[名言]→格言
pre在……前的,预先+cinct捆→预先捆好的→范围
pre在……前的,预先+cipice头→在前面是尽头→峭壁
pre在……前的,预先+cipit头→ation→落在前头→降落,下降
pre在……前的,预先+destination目的地→预先定好的目的地→命中注定
pre在……前的,预先+disposition性情→性情预定→癖性
pre在……前的,预先+fix固定→固定在前面→前缀
pre在……前的,预先+history历史→n.史前
pre在……前的,预先+occup占有+ation表名词→优先占有[注意力]→全神贯注
pre在……前的,预先+position位置→位置放在前面→前置词
pre在……前的,预先+rog要求+ative表名词→预先要求→[有]特权
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+e→走在前面→[时间上]先于
pre在……前的,预先+clud关闭+e→提前关闭→阻止
pre在……前的,预先+dict说→预先说→预言
pre在……前的,预先+fer带来→先带来→更喜欢
pre在……前的,预先+pay付钱→v.预付
aqui水+fer带来,拿来+ous……的→带来水的
differ[v.不同]+ent表形容词→adj.不同的

Sentence.sentence: He prefers a full-time job with more responsibility.
He usually prefers ice-cream to sandwiches.
Oh, actually grey is my favorite color, but I prefer something made from cotton, 100% cotton I mean.

When the Pew Research Center recently asked American parents to identify their"ideal"life arrangement,47 percent of mothers said they would prefer to work park-time and 20percent said they would prefer not to work at all.

When the Pew Research Center recently asked American parents to identify their"ideal"life arrangement,47 percent of mothers said they would prefer to work park-time and 20percent said they would prefer not to work at all.
Most mothers do not aspire to (向往) elite,competitive full-time positions: the Swedish policies have given them the freedom and opportunity to live the lives they prefer.

means.word_mean: 选择某事物(而不选择他事物); 更喜欢

sentences.en: She preferred that nobody should come to see her.
He preferred to die instead of stealing.
sentences.cn: 他宁愿死也不愿意偷窃。

sentences.en: They prefer living in the suburbs.
I should have preferred him to do it in a different way.
sentences.cn: 我倒愿意他用另一种办法做。

sentences.en: Since they are so young, the police have decided not to prefer charges.
sentences.cn: 由于他们很年轻, 警方决定不对他们起诉。

means.word_mean: 提升；提拔；任命；录用；推荐；介绍

sentences.en: We haven't enough evidence to prefer charges.
sentences.cn: 我们没有进行起诉的充分证据。

sentences.en: The young men seem to be preferring some request which the elder ones are indisposed to grant.
sentences.cn: 年轻人似乎想提出某种年纪大的人不愿答应的要求。

sentences.en: We'll go to the Great Wall, if you prefer.
sentences.cn: 你如果愿意的话，我们去长城。

jushi.english: I prefer new works that sing of our life today.
jushi.chinese: 我更喜欢歌颂我们今天生活的新作品。
他更喜欢一般性的处理方法。
